name: Plaza Tour Eiffel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 4 day Paris break at this great hotel. We read lots reviews and were so pleased that we decided to choose this hotel. Stayed in a superior room which was just as described extremely clean and comfortable (clean towels every day and lovely L'Octane toiletries).
reviews.title: Couldn't fault this hotel - loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are v. friendly and helpful no matter what time of day. Had a deal where breakfast was included and it was v.good but not sure that we would have paid the going rate as there are places that are cheaper to eat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Great location just 5mins from metro and the busy Trocadero area that as lively cafes. Metro easy to negotiate and a quick and cheap way to travel, however for a more leisurely trip take the Batbus that travels down the river stopping at the main tourist spots (11Euros for a day ticket).
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay again.
reviews.title: anniversary weekend in August 2008

likes.liked: — friendly and modern and clean and comfortable
likes.disliked: — a bit on the small side but what's new in city hotels?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Paris for a week in this small but very pleasant Hotel, with very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our deal (an August promotion) and was like the hotel small but perfectly formed. More than enough to keep you going and obviously pastries and bread were all fresh.
reviews.title: great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall if you want a base that is well located, with a modern feel, and staff who trip over themselves to help then the Plaza is ideal.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Price of a cup of tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We recently spent four days in Paris and stayed at Plaza Tour Eiffel. The staff was so nice and helpful. The room was bigger than expected and so clean!! The bathroom was spotless everyday. The shower was a little strange but other than that I reccommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Quiet Hotel

likes.liked: — The quiet location but still close to everything.
likes.disliked: — Shower was odd, half a door, you got water on the floor everytime you showered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I guess the title is a little presumptuous but after reading the reviews on TA before we went I think I can help a little more with our review.
reviews.title: Definitive Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We went with two other couples to Paris, this is our second trip and the first trip for the other two couples. I travel abroad extensively as part of my job and am accustomed to staying in 4 - 5 star hotels. So when we were looking into this trip I had to consider the other two couples and their spending limits ... so to the web we went. We looked at at least twenty different hotels, going back and forth on cost vs. features, reading every review we could, consulting a travel agent, etc. until we finally settled on the Tour Eiffel.
reviews.title: Great service, wonderful location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once the booking was complete I was never really sold as I know what European hotels are like and you typically get what you pay for. The 4-5 star hotels are very expensive but you get the amenities of large bathrooms, comfortable beds, in house resteraunt, room services, etc.
reviews.title: Lovely small, modern and well placed Paris hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well knowing all this I was expecting the least from the Tour Eiffel, even though the reviews have been good on TA.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a week stay in Paris at the Plaza Tour Eiffel. I usually do not write reviews but the staff were so nice and helpful I thought it was necessary to let others know about this great hotel. The hotel is located about a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and is in a very quiet part of Paris. It is a good break from the crowded streets at many of the city sights.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a quiet section in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and modern. The room we stayed in was a typical Paris hotel room size but it was comfortable and we had a view of the tower from our window.
reviews.title: Staying with the Residents in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and polite. All speak English and do not seem to mind multiple questions and requests. We particularly appraciated Daniel, Mohammad and Sophie. I would definately reccomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel - Great Location

likes.liked: — Very clean Hotel and helpfull staff.
likes.disliked: — I would have to be very picky to find anything wrong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Paris, and we only had 3 days. I wanted to find someplace special that wouldn't cost us our house! After reading the reviews here, I was fairly confident that we had found the right place....and we did. When we visti other countries, we prefer to stay in places that will allow us to experience a piece of native life....the Plaza Tour Eiffel does that. The hotel is located in an upscale residential area. At 8 AM, watch the mothers and fathers walking their children to school; by 10 AM the older women are walking to the markets. If you head towards the Trocadera, you will pass the Thailand and Spanish Embassies. If you head toward Place de Mexico, you'll pass a local bakery, boutiques and fresh fruit market. We spent every evening sipping wine and eating cheeses at the various bistros at the Trocadera which is a few minute walk from the hotel. There are very few tourists there (relatively speaking), and you'll find yourself immersed in French spoken with the speed of the TGV. (Although all the waitstaff spoke fluent english.) The hotel is lovely. The personnel are helpful in every way, taking our bags from the cabbie and to our room. Our plane came in early, and we were at the hotel at 10:30 AM. we fully expected to leave our bags there and check in later. However, they had a room ready for us which was a treat as we had just come in from the States and were fairly "fried". Our room was a bit small because we had a corner room over the front door, but it suited us fine. The bathroom was spotless, of a good size and has a good hairdryer in it! The storage is primarily in a wardrobe - and it did fit the clothing of two people with no problem. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the pillows. We ended up leaving at 6 AM to catch a flight, and they offered to check us out the night before so we wouldn't be delayed, as well as arranged for a taxi which arrived right on time. Overall, it was a great place to stay...I would recommend it to everyone and anyone. Should we ever be able to return to Paris, I shall stay there again. FYI, the Metro is less than a 5 minute walk away, the Eiffel Tower takes 10-15 minutes to stroll, as does the Batabus, The Arc de Triomphe is about 40 minutes to walk to via the Avenue of New York next to the Seine. The cab fare from the airport was about 45 Euros.
reviews.title: Look at no other, just order your room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three night in September with my daughter and niece. The Hotel Staff made us feel so welcome upon arrival and
reviews.title: Well located, clean, modern & great staff. Highly recommended.

likes.liked: — Very friendly staff, safe & convenient location, clean & modern rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I book this hotel through www.tramazing.com
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: able to find the best and cheapest rate compare to others. Hotel is in good location, clean rooms, overall is good
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel because of it's location and the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. We certainly weren't disappointed. Yes the location is ideal as it's near the Eiffel Tower and Trocadero. There are a good selection of cafes and restaurants nearby so it isn't too far to wander back to the hotel after a pleasant evening eating and drinking.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in a great location

likes.disliked: — Could not find a fault with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is more than worthy of it's 4* rating. Although the rooms are small (who spends a lot of time in their room in Paris anyway?) they are extremely comfortable. Breakfast is plentiful with the usual foods you get with continental breakfast as well as scrambled eggs and ham.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — It was comfortable, staff were friendly and location was ideal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are really fantastic. Nothing is too much trouble. They are extremely polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Amazing romantic vacation - this hotel made all the difference

likes.liked: — Location, service, room accommodations, proximity to attractions, proximity to Metro
likes.disliked: — Nothing, I enjoyed the hotel thoroughly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Well presented rooms though basic rooms are a little on the small side. Polite and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Dissapointing All Round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would return.
reviews.title: Not Just Three Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was expecting a contemporarty Frech experience, however this could not have been further from the truth.
reviews.title: Nothing Special With Significant Downsides

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was expected to go downstairs to get everything I wanted - even the WiFi key?
reviews.title: Ecellente, the place to stay in Paris

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean and a great place to stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was travelling alone and can honestly say I did not feel safe and could hear others through the wall.
reviews.title: Great but....

likes.liked: — It was extremely well situated for the attractions and shopping

description: Close to the Eiffel Tower and the Trocadero, this Boutique Hotel is situated in a very upscale residential area in the heart of the 16th arrondissement of Paris. It enjoys a highly attractive setting with a walking distance of the capitals monuments, restaurant and stores.Entirely renovated, the hotel combines contemporary decor with an elegant atmosphere devoted to your well-being.This 4 stars Boutique Hotel has 41 rooms and Suites, a Fitness room, a Free Wifi Internet access, American Buffet Breakfast, a room service and a nice Lounge Bar.
